summary: Completed comprehensive testing of new Interview Assistant features: Mock Interview with pre-generated suggested answers, Key Points + Brief Explanation format, browser-based TTS, and session timer. All features working correctly.
passed_tests: Backend: generate-mock-questions returns suggested_answer field with Key Points format
Backend: generate-mock-questions works with job_description context
Backend: generate-answer returns Key Points + Brief Explanation format
Backend: generate-answer works with session context
Backend: Session creation includes duration_limit field
Backend: Free tier gets default 15 minute duration limit
Backend: Health endpoint returns healthy status
Backend: Plans endpoint returns subscription plans
Backend: Mock questions have all required fields (category, question, difficulty, tips, suggested_answer)
Frontend: Mock Interview - SUGGESTED ANSWER section visible
Frontend: Mock Interview - Show/Hide toggle button works
Frontend: Mock Interview - Speaker icon for question (speak-question-btn) present
Frontend: Mock Interview - Speaker icon for suggested answer (speak-suggested-btn) present
Frontend: Mock Interview - Questions display with Key Points format in suggested_answer
Frontend: Live Interview - Session timer displays correctly (MM:SS / MM:SS format)
Frontend: Live Interview - Speaker icon next to Copy button (speak-answer-btn) present
Frontend: Live Interview - Answers display in Key Points + Brief Explanation format
Frontend: Live Interview - Copy button works
critical_code_review_comments: ESLint warnings in MockInterview.jsx and LiveInterview.jsx about missing dependencies in useEffect hooks - not critical but should be addressed for code quality
seed_data_creation: Created test sessions for Mock Interview and Live Interview testing
context_for_next_testing_agent: New features tested: 1) Mock Interview now generates questions with pre-loaded suggested_answer field in Key Points + Brief Explanation format, 2) Live Interview answers use Key Points + Brief Explanation format, 3) Browser-based TTS using Web Speech API (no external API needed) - speaker icons use Volume2 from lucide-react, 4) Session timer displays elapsed time vs duration limit. TTS is client-side only, no backend testing needed.

mock_interview_suggested_answers.details: Questions include suggested_answer field with Key Points + Brief Explanation format

mock_interview_show_hide_toggle.details: Show/Hide button toggles suggested answer visibility

mock_interview_tts_question.details: Speaker icon (Volume2) present for reading questions aloud

mock_interview_tts_suggested_answer.details: Speaker icon (Volume2) present for reading suggested answers aloud

live_interview_key_points_format.details: Answers display with **Key Points:** and **Brief Explanation:** sections

live_interview_tts.details: Speaker icon (Volume2) present next to Copy button for reading answers aloud

session_timer.details: Timer displays elapsed time (MM:SS) / duration limit (MM:SS) format

notes: TTS uses browser's built-in Web Speech API (speechSynthesis) - no external API calls needed. The TTS functionality is client-side only and cannot be fully tested via automated tests, but UI elements (speaker icons) are verified present.
